in a way that causes harm or damage: detrimentally affected She argues that local residents will be detrimentally affected by the proposed development. The company were aware that late payments would detrimentally impact the business.
More examplesFewer examplesEmployment legislation states that you cannot be treated detrimentally or dismissed on the grounds of pregnancy. It's clearly an unacceptable situation, which is detrimentally affecting my son's education. Frequent delays in the system detrimentally impact on the country's ability to attract inward investment.
